name: patina
description: Applies subtle color tints to your editor windows based on the open project, so you can easly tell your workspaces apart.

patina.enabled.description: Enable or disable Patina color tinting globally.

patina.workspace.modify.description: Tracks whether Patina has modified this workspace's colors. Set to false to opt-out of Patina for this specific workspace.

enumDescriptions: Path relative to a custom base path
patina.workspaceIdentifier.source.description: Determines what value is used to generate the workspace color.

patina.workspaceIdentifier.customBasePat.description: Base path for 'pathRelativeToCustom' source. Supports ~ for home. Falls back to absolute path if workspace is outside this path.

enumDescriptions: Automatically detect from VSCode's current theme
patina.tint.mode.description: Theme mode for color generation. Auto-detects from VSCode's current theme.

patina.elements.titleBar.description: Apply color tint to the window title bar.

patina.elements.statusBar.description: Apply color tint to the bottom status bar.

patina.elements.activityBar.description: Apply color tint to the left side activity bar.

patina.theme.blendFactor.description: How much to blend tint colors toward the theme's background color. 0 = no blending (vivid colors), 1 = fully match theme (subtle colors). Only applies to known themes.

patina.theme.backgroundColors.description: Custom theme background colors for themes not in the built-in list or to override built-in values.

kind.description: Whether this is a dark or light theme

scripts.compile: pnpm run check-types && pnpm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: pnpm run check-types && pnpm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: pnpm run compile-tests && pnpm run compile && pnpm run lint
